unnormalised: Okay, so I was explaining "bandwidth" to my grandmom the other day. You know, trying to sound all cool and tech-savvy. She asked what that even meant. I started with the whole "it's like the size of a pipe" thing, you know, the one where the bigger the pipe, the more data can flow thru. Then I threw in some jargon like "Mbps" (megabits per second) and she just looked at me like I'd started speaking Martian. Turns out, Mbps is just a fancy way of saying how many Bollywood movies you can download at once before your internet crawls slower than a snail doing the naagin dance.
